newsitem.title: USA: SIBIA drugs show reversal of memory loss.
newsitem.headline: SIBIA drugs show reversal of memory loss.

text.p: SIBIA Neurosciences Inc said on Thursday that in an animal study, a series of its chemical compounds reversed memory deficits associated with aging, memory-impairing drugs and brain injury.
SIBIA said it would try to develop the series of nicotinic acetylcholine receptor-selective compounds as therapeutics for Alzheimer's disease and other dementias.

Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors (NAChR) modulate the release of brain neurotransmitters acetylcholine and dopamine. Alzheimer's and Parkinson's patients show a lack of the receptors and lower levels of acetylcholine and/or dopamine.

In the animal study, SIBIA's SIB-1553A compounds were highly effective in generating the release of acetylcholine from the hippocampus and the frontal cortex -- regions of the brain relevant for memory and learning.
